title: Top French court rules major porn sites must check users' ages
subhead: Major pornographic websites Pornhub, YouPorn and RedTube must verify the ages of their users in France, the country's top administrative court ruled, in a decision on a legal battle that has been ongoing since March.

title: Tour de France 2025: The first 10 days of racing, in photos
subhead: While the riders and their teams enjoy a rest day on Tuesday, Le Monde looks back at the beginning of the 112th Tour de France, which started on July 5 in Lille.

title: Photography, politics and protest collide at Rencontres d'Arles
subhead: The 56th Rencontres d'Arles opened with a 15% rise in attendance. But behind the packed halls and sold-out screenings, tensions flared over cries of cultural gentrification, uneven art shows and political protests.

title: How North Korea infiltrates its IT experts into Western companies
subhead: Developers working under false identities aim to funnel their salaries back to the North Korean state or blackmail their employers. Major companies have been affected, primarily in the United States but, more recently, also in France.

title: The dazzling legacy of iconoclastic jewelry designer Attilio Codognato
subhead: Known for his snake- and skull-shaped jewelry, the iconoclastic designer who died in 2023 also left behind an astonishing collection of works by Andy Warhol, Marcel Duchamp and Maurizio Cattelan, now fiercely protected by his children. His Venetian boutique, once a magnet for global celebrities, remains the only place in the world to find Codognato's singular creations.

title: Bastille Day in 1945: Versailles, the city of the Sun King, swept up in republican jubilation
subhead: '1945, A French Summer' (1/6). On Saturday, July 14, 1945, Versailles was celebrating as it had not done in years. But the carefree spirit of some clashed with the return of deportees and the restrictions still in place.
